description: The Exodus Wallet is the best multi coin crypto wallet around.
Excellent. Iopefully the will include more currencies soon and make it easy to hide all of them , especially the unused ones.

Exodus is one of the best cryptocurrency wallets out there. There are numerous features I like:

1. It supports over 100 currencies. I do not use all of them, of course. However, it is great to know that I will be able to receive cryptocurrencies without making a brand new wallet.

2. It has apps built-in. A few examples are the FTX app to buy crypto directly in your wallet and a staking app where the APY is surprisingly good.

3. It is pleasing to look at. I absolutely love how they gave us spectacular designs.

4. You can get information quickly through the charts.

5. Last but definitely not the least, you have access to your private keys so that you own your wallet.

All in all, I am extremely happy with Exodus.

If I was to compare Exodus to any other Linux crypto-wallet that I know of, I'd probably had to give it at least five starts. 

Exodus does the job, not just for a handful of coins but for many. Not only that but it also have a decent, albeit slightly more costly, exchange embedded.

So, for the above summarized reasons, Exodus is quite convenient. However, the GUI interface is really, really annoying. The fonts are quite small, with little contrast and overall quite difficult to read. The text cannot be copied unless there's an option for it by an icon. That means that if I want to quickly copy-paste a transaction into a spreadsheet the only option is to export into a csv file and then import it or copy-past from there. It's OKish, doable but not practical. Yet, as mentioned, the most annoying thing are the fonts used and their size, contrast and colors.

One last thing: it's NOT opensource. This does not just go against the spirit of cooperation and community but also against basic privacy and security principles. One has to trust the company 100%. This with software that deals with money and very private details is very, very worrisome.
summary: GOOD CRYPTO WALLET. VERY IMPRACTICAL GUI

description: I am hoping for the day when Exodus will officially support flatpak. There is no need for multiple linux package types. If you cannot access printers or camera, or some other resource, it is because you have not used Flatseal to tweak the settings for the Exodus flatpak.
I love this iteration of it but I wonder whether it is official or not. I use the one from the website.
Beautiful, easy to use app. Thank you.
The UI is too dark for me

It being a crypto app and all, being open-source is basically required. I don't mean this in a tinfoil-hat way, but there have been examples of crypto wallet apps biding their time and collecting users' keys, then stealing all the funds. Additionally, if something internal at Exodus goes wrong that causes malicious or even just insecure and poorly-written code to be added, users have no way of knowing.

I like the UI and it's fairly easy to use, and would be 4 or 5 stars if it were open-source. But because it's not, two stars, simply because that makes it unfortunately unusable.
summary: Good UI, but close-source software means not trustworthy and unusable
